title: 106_hr3846
content: The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to increase the minimum wage to $5.15 an hour starting September 1, 1997, $5.48 an hour from April 1, 2000, $5.81 an hour from April 1, 2001, and $6.15 an hour from April 1, 2002. Additionally, there is an exemption for computer professionals. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to exempt certain computer professionals, including analysts, designers, developers, programmers, and engineers, whose primary duties involve systems, network, or database analysis and development. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to exempt certain computer professionals involved in the analysis, creation, testing, securing, or modification of computer systems, networks, databases, or programs based on user specifications. This includes management or training of employees with similar duties. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to exempt computer professionals involved in computer systems, networks, databases, or programs. Employees must be compensated at a rate of at least $27.63 an hour to meet the exemption criteria. The term 'network' includes the Internet, intranet networks, and the world wide web. SEC. 3. EXEMPTION FOR CERTAIN SALES EMPLOYEES. Amendment to the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 exempts certain sales employees based on specialized knowledge, sales focus, understanding of customer needs, and discretion in offering products/services. The amendment to the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 exempts sales employees who receive base compensation at one and a half times the minimum wage and additional compensation based on sales, ensuring their aggregate sales-based compensation is at least 40 percent of the minimum wage. The amendment exempts sales employees who receive base compensation at 1.5 times the minimum wage and additional compensation based on sales, ensuring their total sales-based compensation is at least 40% of the minimum wage. This amendment does not apply to individuals employed as route sales drivers. SEC. 4. EXEMPTION FOR FUNERAL DIRECTORS. This section amends the Fair Labor Standards Act to exempt licensed funeral directors and embalmers from certain provisions. SEC. 5. STATE MINIMUM WAGE. State minimum wage legislation is amended to allow employers in states with a minimum wage of at least $5.15 per hour to pay employees below the federal minimum wage.
